intro: Pilosella kalksburgensis subsp. catoschista, commonly known as the Kalksburg hairvetch, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of Europe. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant is distinguished by its dense, woolly foliage and small, yellowish flowers that bloom in the summer. It typically grows in dry, grassy habitats and is adapted to rocky or sandy soils. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
